thread.title: The 10 Richest Fashion Icons: Louis Vuitton Net Worth Vs. Ralph Lauren Net Worth
thread.title_full: The 10 Richest Fashion Icons: Louis Vuitton Net Worth Vs. Ralph Lauren Net Worth

author: Holly Hammersmith
title: The 10 Richest Fashion Icons: Louis Vuitton Net Worth Vs. Ralph Lauren Net Worth
text:
By Holly Hammersmith September 2, 2015 
New York Fashion Week 2015 kicks off Sept. 10 and continues through Sept. 17. Fashion lovers will be tuning into the show for the latest styles and trends from the most famous international models and designers. From Giorgio Armani to Louis Vuitton, find out which of your favorite designers — and brands — will be attending New York Fashion Week, and how much they’re worth. 
Related: Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour’s Net Worth 1. Giorgio Armani Net Worth: $7.7 Billion 
Self-made Italian designer Giorgio Armani has a net worth of $7.7 billion, according to Forbes. The legend was born into a working class family, served in the military and later worked as a buyer and window dresser. By the 1970s Armani had begun launching his own clothes lines, gaining notoriety when he designed the wardrobe for the 1980 blockbuster “American Gigolo.” The designer, unfortunately, will not be showing at this September’s New York Fashion Week. 2. Manolo Blahnik Net Worth: $200 Million 
Manolo Blahnik’s net worth is $200 million, according to Celebrity Net Worth. The Spanish fashion designer is best-known for his collection of high-end shoes. Blahnik started his career in Paris, where he worked at a clothes store. He later worked in London as a buyer for a boutique before finding an interest in shoes. After learning about shoe design, he began crafting his own designs, which lead to his success. Blahnik will not be showing at New York Fashion Week. 3. Christian Dior Net Worth: $10 Million 
Renowned French designer Christian Dior had an estimated net worth of $10 million. His company of the same name, however, is worth an estimated $35.1 billion. It commands numerous business groups producing products from luxury handbags to shoes, wine and perfumes. Christian Dior will not be showing at New York Fashion Week 2015. 4. Stefano Gabbana Net Worth: $1.64 Billion 
Stefano Gabbana, half of the famed fashion line Dolce & Gabbana, is worth an estimated $1.64 billion. Partner Domenico Dolce is also worth a reported $1.64 billion. Although the two command Dolce & Gabbana and were once in a relationship, their personal relationship reportedly ended in 2003. Dolce & Gabbana is not on the showing list for New York Fashion Week. 5. Ralph Lauren Net Worth: $6.2 Billion 
Once the owner of a small tie store, Ralph Lauren grew to notoriety when Neiman Marcus ordered 1,200 of his ties. The self-made entrepreneur reportedly controls 81.5 percent of the voting power at Ralph Lauren, despite the company going public in 1997. The 75-year-old Ralph Lauren has a net worth of $6.2 billion and his brand of the same name is worth $12 billion. Ralph Lauren will be showing at New York Fashion Week on Thursday, Sept. 17. 6. Miuccia Prada Net Worth: $2.9 Billion 
Fashion guru Miuccia Prada has a net worth of $2.9 billion and reportedly has a 35 percent stake in Prada. As a renowned designer of handbags and clothing, Prada is considered fashion royalty. Unfortunately, Prada will not be showing at this month’s New York Fashion Week. 7. Yves Saint Laurent Net Worth: $154 Million 
Among the most talented French fashion designers of the past century, Yves Saint Laurent had a net worth estimated at $154 million. Although Laurent died in 2008 due to brain cancer, he was named a top-earning celebrity in 2009 by Forbes after a record-breaking auction of art, antiques and furniture he shared with his partner, Pierre Berge. Luxury fashion line Yves Saint Laurent will not be showing at this September’s New York Fashion Week. 8. Vera Wang Net Worth: $400 Million 
From Victoria Beckham to Ivanka Trump, Vera Wang has dressed some of the world’s most famous brides. Wang’s net worth is estimated at $400 million. The designer has her roots as the owner of a bridal shop. She now sells her design worldwide in 21 stores. Wang also reportedly earns money from licensing deals with David’s Bridal, Kohl’s and Zales. Vera Wang is reportedly showing at New York Fashion Week 2015 on Tuesday, Sept. 15. 9. Diane von Furstenberg Net Worth: $450 Million 
Diane von Furstenberg is worth an estimated $450 million and is famous for her iconic wrap dress. The designer shares ownership of DVF with her husband, Barry Diller, a media billionaire. According to the New York Fashion Week schedule, Diane von Furstenberg will be showing on Sunday, Sept. 13. 10. Bernard Arnault Net Worth: $35.1 Billion 
The man behind Louis Vuitton, Bernard Arnault, and his family have a net worth estimated at $35.1 billion. Arnault reportedly oversees an empire of brands, including Fendi and Sephora, under the umbrella of LVMH. Luxury brand Louis Vuitton has a net worth estimated at $28.1 billion. It will not be showing at this September’s New York Fashion Week, according to schedule. Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week New York Highlights
